detaileddescription.para: After this method has completed, the manager should be completely initialized and "ready for action".

simplesect.para: Initialization of any given manager may depend on other managers having been initialized before. KernelManager::initialize() is responsible for calling the initialization routines on the specific managers in correct order.

detaileddescription.para: After this method has completed, all dynamic data structures created by the manager shall be deallocated and containers emptied. Plain variables need not be reset.

simplesect.para: Finalization of any given manager may depend on other managers not having been finalized yet. KernelManager::finalize() is responsible for calling the initialization routines on the specific managers in correct order, i.e., the opposite order of initialize() calls.

detaileddescription.para: Returns thread ID if OpenMP is installed and zero otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set the number of threads by setting the internal variable n_threads_, the corresponding value in the Communicator, and the OpenMP number of threads.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the total number of threads per process.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the given global node exists on this vp.
Returns thread local index of a given global node.
Returns the node ID of a given local index.
Return a thread number for a given global node id.

detaileddescription.para: Each node has a default thread on which it will run. The thread is defined by the relation: t = (node_id div P) mod T, where P is the number of simulation processes and T the number of threads. This may be used by Network::add_node() if the user has not specified anything.

briefdescription.para: Convert a given VP ID to the corresponding thread ID.
Convert a given thread ID to the corresponding VP ID.
Return true, if the given VP is on the local machine.
Returns the number of virtual processes.
Returns the number of processes that are taken care of by a single thread while processing MPI buffers in a multithreaded environment.

memberdef.argsstring: (const thread rank_start, const thread num_assigned_ranks_per_thread) const
memberdef.name: get_end_rank_per_thread

briefdescription.para: Returns assigned ranks per thread to fill MPI buffers.

detaileddescription.para: Thread tid is responsible for all ranks in [assigned_ranks.begin, assigned_ranks.end), which are in total assigned_ranks.size and at most assigned_ranks.max_size

briefdescription.para: Fails if NEST is in thread-parallel section.
